message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $11,500. It's a great deal for you, as it's worth $12,000 to you. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $10,500. I'm willing to make a fair deal, but I need to save some money on this purchase.

Bob, I understand you're trying to save money, but $10,500 is a little too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $11,000. This is a fair price considering the value of the product to you. Let's meet in the middle.
I appreciate your willingness to come down to $11,000, but I'm still a bit short of my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $10,750. I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $10,750 is still a little low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $10,900, which is a fair compromise. This way, we can both get a good deal.  Let's close this deal!
I'm getting close to my budget, but I still need to save a bit more. I'll offer $10,600. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to make sure I'm getting a good deal.

Bob, I understand you're working within a budget, but $10,600 is still a little too low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer the product for $10,700. This is a fair price for both of us, and we can finally close this deal. What do you say?

I'm getting closer to my budget, but I still need to save a bit more. I'll offer $10,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to make sure I'm getting a good deal. Can we meet at this price?
